abstract.text: Creates a mesh in the shape of an ellipsoid or sphere.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A vector containing the width (x-component), height (y-component), and depth (z-component) of the bounding box of the ellipsoid to generate. If all components are equal, this method generates a sphere.

The number of points to generate around the horizontal circumference of the ellipsoid (that is, its cross-section in the xz-plane). A larger number of points increases rendering fidelity but decreases rendering performance.
The number of points to generate along the height of the ellipsoid. A larger number of points increases rendering fidelity but decreases rendering performance.
The type of geometric primitive — triangles or quads — from which to construct the mesh.
to generate normal vectors pointing toward the center of the ellipsoid;
to generate normal vectors pointing outward.
to generate only the upper half of the ellipsoid or sphere (a dome);
to generate a complete ellipsoid or sphere.
An object responsible for allocating mesh vertex data. If
, Model I/O  uses an internal allocator object.
A new mesh object.
This method generates vertex data for an ellipsoid centered at the origin of its local coordinate system.
The
parameter determines the direction of generated vertex normal vectors for the mesh. Specify
if the mesh will be viewed from inside (for example, for use in a sky effect), or
if the mesh will be viewed from outside.
The
parameter controls vertex data allocation for the mesh. For example, to use the MetalKit framework for loading vertex data into GPU buffers for rendering using Metal, pass a
object. By specifying an allocator, you can ensure that mesh data is copied a minimal number of times between being read from a file and being loaded into GPU memory for rendering.

abstract.text: An interface for allocating a MetalKit buffer that backs the vertex data of a Model I/O mesh, suitable for use in a Metal app.
A false value.
A true value.
Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
Types of geometric primitives for rendering a submesh, used by the
property.
A container for vertex buffer data to be used in rendering a 3D object.
Creates a mesh in the shape of a rectangular box or cube.
Generates a mesh in the shape of a right circular or elliptical cylinder.
Creates a mesh in the shape of an ellipsoid or sphere.
Generates a mesh in the shape of an elliptical or circular cone.
Generates a mesh in the shape of a regular 20-sided polyhedron with triangular faces.
Generates a mesh in the shape of a rectangular plane.
The general interface for managing allocation of data buffers to be used in loading, processing, and rendering meshes.
The type of geometric primitives described by the submesh’s index buffer.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Describes an unsigned integer.
A floating point vector type used to perform physics calculations.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A signed integer value type.

inlineContent.text: A vector containing the width (x-component), height (y-component), and depth (z-component) of the bounding box of the ellipsoid to generate. If all components are equal, this method generates a sphere.

The number of points to generate around the horizontal circumference of the ellipsoid (that is, its cross-section in the xz-plane). A larger number of points increases rendering fidelity but decreases rendering performance.
The number of points to generate along the height of the ellipsoid. A larger number of points increases rendering fidelity but decreases rendering performance.
The type of geometric primitive — triangles or quads — from which to construct the mesh.
to generate normal vectors pointing toward the center of the ellipsoid;
to generate normal vectors pointing outward.
to generate only the upper half of the ellipsoid or sphere (a dome);
to generate a complete ellipsoid or sphere.
An object responsible for allocating mesh vertex data. If
, Model I/O  uses an internal allocator object.
A new mesh object.
